definition: to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: The other, Albert Ho Chun-yan, is thus a no-hoper.
sentences.chinese: 如此看来，另一位参选者何俊仁是没什么希望了。

sentences.english: I understand and accept the Three Shadows Photography Award selection criteria.
sentences.chinese: 本人已了解并接受三影堂摄影奖的参选规则。

sentences.english: Joining the election would at least prevent Chief Secretary Donald Tsang Yam-kuen, the frontrunner, being returned unopposed.
sentences.chinese: 参选至少可以阻止大热门政务司司长曾荫权自动当选。

sentences.english: His refusal to seek a third presidential term cemented that.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝参选连任第三任总统使这一点得到牢固确立。

sentences.english: During this year's election as Labour MP Labour Party candidate against Chet.
sentences.chinese: 今年大选期间工党禁止切特作为工党议员参选。

sentences.english: My current choice is to be elected Sinbei City mayor.
sentences.chinese: 目前我的选择是参选新北市市长。

sentences.english: They don't have to worry too much about who will be contesting in Sandakan.
sentences.chinese: 他们不必太担心谁将会在山打根参选了。

sentences.english: Nader is running again this year, this time as an independent.
sentences.chinese: 内德今年再次参选，不过这次是以独立党派身份。

sentences.english: Esther Yang, who is running for New York State Assemble 74th District, visited CCBA.
sentences.chinese: 有意参选纽约州74选区众议员的杨天发访中华公所。

sentences.english: The candidates slugged it out in a series of debates.
sentences.chinese: 参选者们在一连串的辩论中猛烈厮杀。

sentences.english: Since there are only one cabinet in the election, vote of confidence is used.
sentences.chinese: 由于只有一个内阁参选，所以采用信任票制。

sentences.english: She ran as a pro-choice Republican and lost narrowly.
sentences.chinese: 她以亲共和党的身份参选，以微弱差距落选。

sentences.english: I have no intention for 5 gold benefit.
sentences.chinese: 我绝不会为5金而参选的人。

sentences.english: Huckabee is competing for the Republican presidential nomination.
sentences.chinese: 赫卡比是共和党总统提名人的参选人。

sentences.english: The Frontier's Andrew To Kwan-hang will be listed on a separate ticket.
sentences.chinese: 前线的陶君行会从一张独立名单参选。

sentences.english: The Election Law allows each candidate to spend up to K10 million ($10,000).
sentences.chinese: 选举法允许参选者花费超过10000美元。

definition: to take part in an election/to run for office
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
